text: Facebook is not relevant anymore. I think Snapchat, VRChat, Twitch, Discord are the new “cool” places to be. One unique advantage of VR could be a less crowded social network, where you presumably can punch people too.  Facebook was already dead the moment they were no longer trying to do anything innovative but just trying to be relevant by mergers and acquisition like WhatsApp, Instagram and  Oculus and fake expansion into other countries just to increase vanity metrics. When a company starts copying its competitors, you know that mbas have taken over the management.

text:
WMR is probably closest to fitting your criteria. Realistically you probably need Steam or MS Store to actually get apps, but I guess you could side load everything and have no explicit launcher or new store login. You can side load though. 

<https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/mixed-reality/enthusiast-guide/set-up-windows-mixed-reality|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/mixed-reality/enthusiast-guide/set-up-windows-mixed-reality>

Wayland has a XR compositor called WXRC. No idea how mature it is or if it's usable though l
